function.name: mongo_find
function.description: Retrieves all objects from collection that match query. If query is null or not specified it will return all objects in collection. If mongo is not provided the last active connection will be used.NOTE: Do not use this function to find objects by “_id”, as these are internally generated by mongo. This is because in mongoDB autogenerated id’s are an ObjectId object, and thus do not match a string id. Use mongo_get to get objects by id instead.

example.description: Get all objects from the “employees” collection:
Find all objects from the “employees” collection whose name is “John”.
